column1:
Overall, the data highlights the improvements in the Cleaniness, Amenities, Location, Services, and General metrics from 2018 to 2023.

Cleaniness:
The Cleaniness metric has seen the most growth from 2018 to 2023, increasing from 0% in 2018 to 57.8% in 2020, before slowly decreasing to 58.1% in 2021 and 58.3% in 2022.

Amenities:
The Amenities metric has remained fairly consistent from 2018 to 2023, initially increasing from 75.1% in 2018 to a peak of 67.9% in 2020 before gradually decreasing to 63.2% in 2021 and 65.4% in 2022.

Location:
The Location metric has seen the second most growth from 2018 to 2023, increasing from 0% in 2018 to 64.7% in 2020 before slowly decreasing to 66.6% in 2021 and 62.3% in 2022.

Services:
The Services metric has increased from 0% in 2018 to 63.1% in 2020, before slightly decreasing to 60.3% in 2021 and 59.3% in 2022.

General:
The General metric has remained fairly consistent over this period, initially increasing from 67% in 2018 to 65.2% in 2020 before gradually decreasing to 64.4% in 2021 and 65.7% in 2022.

Overall, there is room for improvement in all aspects. The Cleaniness metric can be improved by increasing the focus on hygiene and sanitation, such as proper sanitation of facilities and the use of protective equipment such as masks and gloves. The Amenities metric can be improved by increasing the number of amenities available, such as better Wi-Fi connections, more comfortable furniture, and improved facilities. The Location can be improved by providing more convenient transportation options and services, such as car-sharing services and better public transport. The Services metric can be improved by providing better services such as more responsive customer service and more frequent maintenance. Lastly, the General metric can be improved by increasing the focus on customer satisfaction, such as providing better training to staff and improving the overall quality of the services and amenities.
